results.title: Some babies die
results.brief_description: An exploration of stillbirth and neonatal grief by sharing the experience of two families. One family, under the guidance of a specialised medical team, undergoes an unusual counselling process to help them resolve their grief more easily. They are encouraged to spend time seeing, holding and touching their dead baby. This is a film which questions our attitudes on death.

results.title: Some Australian birds
results.creator_credit: S.T. Evans, CSIRO and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The work of the wild life survey section of the CSIRO. Includes close study of the function of the lyrebird’s mimicry; the nesting habits of the mallee fowl, a shy bird which builds a high mound; the king penguin which lives on Macquarie Island in large colonies, and the Tasmanian mutton birds which support a small industry.

results.title: Some are more equal than others
results.creator_credit: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: Briefly traces the history of the development of equal opportunity. A representative from the Equal Opportunity Board and the Youth Affairs Council discuss the equal opportunity legislation and how it affects youth.

results.title: Some American sculpture
results.creator_credit: Frederick H Stein, United States Information Service and Sketches
results.brief_description: Offers a view of the work, philosophy and work habits of three modern American sculptors - Jennie Lea Knight who works with wood; George Mueller who works with steel; and, Fred Eversley who works with plastic.

results.title: Some American feminists
results.creator_credit: Margaret Wescott, Nicole Brossard, Luce Guilbeault and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film was shot in New York City in 1975 and 1976…and is not intended as a definitive statement on feminism, the women, or the movement, but rather a documentary exploring the experiences, feelings and philosophies of some American feminists. It contains a series of interviews, interspersed with newsreel footage, placing the American feminist movement in a historical perspective. Six of the women who gave impetus to the movement, Betty Friedan (author), Kate Millett (author and sculptor), Rita Mae Brown (author and poet), Lila Karp (writer and professor of women’s studies), Ti-Grace Atkinson (feminist theorist and activist) and Margo Jefferson (writer and critic), discuss those issues that most concern them, and which are still being debated. Interviewer: Luce Guilbeault.

results.title: Somazone (MAC & PC)
results.creator_credit: Richard Jones, Tom Olsson, Electric Alchemy, National Asthma Campaign, Legal Aid Commission of Victoria, Quit, Human Services and Cinemedia
results.brief_description: SomaZone is about exploring, experimenting and making choices. It’s a “Life-Simulator” which gives teenagers a chance for real decision-making. By creating a “personal body”, users can take risks and see what happens. SomaZone is a multimedia package designed to look at health, society and the law from the perspective of adolescents. Discussion notes are included in the CD in WORD format. Technical requirements: Will run on PC and MAC. PC’s need Windows 3.1 or later; 486 - 66 CPU; 6MB of free RAM; 2 x CD-ROM drive; SVGA (256 colours); 16 bit Soundblaster or compatible; Quicktime for Windows 2.1.2 (supplied). Macintosh: System 7 or later; 030 - 30MHz; 6 MB of free Ram; 2 x CD-ROM drive; 256 colours; Quicktime 2.5 supplied.

results.title: Solving work problems (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Improving Performance”.
Peter Quarry introduces a hree step process for discussing poor work performance with staff. Discusses real life examples of common mistakes together with the correct way to counsel staff.

results.title: Solving the problem (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Improving Performance”.
The final step in the process of performance appraisal is reaching a solution relevant to the problem and its cause which involves considering realistic options, agreeing on a clear action plan and setting a review date to ensure the plan is working.
